properties.tree_description:
Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Unbalanced phototrophic canopy shaded by pressure from wisteria and other nearby trees. One leader has three close-proximity breakage events unlikely to compartmentalize. Overall canopy is bowed and unbalanced.
		
		
			Tree number:2Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):11Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Under the 12? threshold. Documented here for permitting recognition, though not technically protected, to avoid potential conflicts later. Unbalanced canopy engulfed in invasives.
		
		
			Tree number:3Species:Leyland Cypress Tree Size (DBH):11Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Undesirable species per City of Atlanta, canopy suppressed, engulfed in invasives
		
		
			Tree number:4Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):11Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Under the 12? threshold. Documented here for permitting recognition, though not technically protected, to avoid potential conflicts later. 
		
		
			Tree number:5Species:PoplarTree Size (DBH):6Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Canopy suppressed by invasives, loss of vertical habit, little to no crown
		
		
			Tree number:6Species:PoplarTree Size (DBH):14Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Soil, rocks, and debris piled at the base. Engulfed in invasives with trunk girdling from wisteria vines.
		
		
			Tree number:7Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):23Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Fill at base, engulfed in invasives, unbalanced canopy, three cankers (two with pitch, one with decay), borer evidence, concrete and stone dumpage
		
		
			Tree number:8Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):22Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Engulfed in invasives, fill, basal canker, concrete debris, old dumping evident 
		
		
			Tree number:9Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):15Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Fill and stone dumping at base, engulfed in invasives, off-balance canopy
		
		
			Tree number:10Species:Maple Tree Size (DBH):10Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Engulfed in wisteria, main leader broken with active decay, fill around base
		
		
			Tree number:11Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):16Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Engulfed in invasives, fusiform canker visible, soil piled around base and other debris nearby
		
		
			Tree number:12Species:HWTree Size (DBH):12Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Standing dead pole
		
		
			Tree number:14Species:Oak Tree Size (DBH):18Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:The main central leader has undergone a breakage event at the bending moment on the tension side, with active oozing at the breakage site. Wisteria is present throughout the canopy along with multiple broken branches. While the branch failures are not structurally critical, they are notable. Evidence of soil and debris dumping is present around the base, indicating past disturbance.
		
		
			Tree number:14Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):13Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Evidence of concrete and stone dumping around the base. Some wisteria present on the trunk. Low live crown ratio indicating limited vigor.
		
		
			Tree number:17Species:Sweetgum Tree Size (DBH):13Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Engulfed in invasives, leader appears broken, canopy dieback on back side
		
		
			Tree number:18Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):16Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Unbalanced canopy lean toward rear, heavily infested with wisteria, full canopy not visible
		
		
			Tree number:19Species:HW Tree Size (DBH):8Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbeed flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Engulfed in invasives, mid-trunk strangled, broken leaders, suppressed canopy, low LCR
